name: places/ChIJERsDN7pZwokRjYt7nh7tPgg
adrFormatAddress: 749 Broadway, New York, NY 10003, USA

originalText.text: I went to deposit my check, 4 quarters, and 2 nickels. The teller; name given by her coworkers “Precious” first refused to deposit the coins stating I have to wrap them up. LoL! It’s 6 coins… senseless. She scrutinized the coins. Asked 3 times what I want.. each time I reply deposit. She bends down to pull out her coin tray making a whole scene oh stressing it is; then told her coworker “these customers need to wrap up their coins”. WHOA! That was the last straw. I asked to see the manager. She refused and said the manager isn’t there. That’s she’s in charge. No way this hood attitude is in charge. Her coworker lucky step in; while she wave nasty gesturing me to go. Her coworker took down my number to call me and told me her name is “Precious”. I have yet to receive any calls from her manager. I filed a complaint. The surveys for this branch is near just 1 star. Which is the lowest anyone can give; practically a 0. My bankers, colleagues, etc.  everywhere are aware. The manager there should know the particular teller acts up when he or she isn’t around.

originalText.text: I came in to open an account. No one was at the front desk so I got on the teller line. There was only one teller helping one person ahead of me. Four other employees sitting around chit chatting. After waiting ten minutes I gave up and walked out.

text.text: I came in to open an account. No one was at the front desk so I got on the teller line. There was only one teller helping one person ahead of me. Four other employees sitting around chit chatting. After waiting ten minutes I gave up and walked out.

originalText.text: There is a teller who has the worst Vibe and Energy ever. Poor guy but really shouldn't be working dealing with people. I just closed a 15 year bank account because of him. I rather not disclose what he did to me but watch out because he is mean person.

originalText.text: Not sure why all the negative reviews; I have been there twice recently and the teller and a personal banker, Megan Eberhardt, were very helpful and patient. My online banking was locked so I went there and Megan spent an hour helping me deal with unlocking the account as well as making an international wire transfer. I had lost faith in Citibank but the 2 ladies there helped somewhat restore it. Since my local branch closed, I am using this as my branch now.

originalText.text: Worst experience in the WORLD. The teller, shorter indian lady, was incredibly rude. Was depositing into landlords account and she literally treated my like a criminal. Took my passport, other teller came over during our transaction and tried to act as a decoy and made up a story of how he was going to Europe and wanted to visit my country while I was there which is literally on the OTHER SIDE OF THE WORLD and in a different HEMISPHERE. It was suppose to be a simple deposit. VERY rude, VERY dumb people, who are in charge of looking after peoples networth...Makes you think.
